titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Clovis E. Byers Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Aparna Mukherjee

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-01-15T12:08-0800

change.item: Revision to correct extent, photo file labeling

physdesc.extent: 47 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 3 envelopes, 4 album boxes, 1 oversize folder, 1 motion picture film reel, 1 phonotape reel

did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, diaries, speeches and writings, clippings, personnel records, and audiovisual material, relating to the Pacific Theater during World War II, the Army of Occupation in Japan, the Korean War, and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization command in Europe.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copiesof audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Clovis E. Byers papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was acquired by the Hoover Insitution Archives in 1964

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Columbus, Ohio
Attended Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio
Graduated from West Point and was commissioned a Second Lieutenant in the Cavalry
Student, Cavalry School
Student, Signal School
Promoted to First Lieutenant
Student, Special Advanced Equitation Course, Cavalry School, Fort Riley, Kansas
Served with 8th Cavalry Regiment
Commanding officer, Cadet Company, United States Military Academy
Promoted to Captain
Promoted to Major
Promoted to Lieutenant Colonel (temporary)
Promoted to Colonel and Brigadier General (temporary). Awarded Distinguished Service Cross, Silver Star, and Purple Heart
Promoted to Lieutenant Colonel, United States Army
Awarded Oak-Leaf Cluster to the Silver Star, Legion of Merit, Bronze Star Medal, Oak-Leaf Cluster to the Silver and Bronze Star, and Air Medal
Promoted to Major General (temporary), United States Army. Awarded Distinguished Service Medal and Second Oak-Leaf Cluster to the Bronze Star
Awarded Military Merit Medal
Awarded Commander of the Order of the British Empire (CBS)
Promoted to Brigadier General, United States Army. Awarded Oak-Leaf Cluster to Legion of Merit and French Legion of Honor Officer Rank
Promoted to Major General, United States Army
Deputy Commandant, National War College, Washington, D.C.
Promoted to Lieutenant General, United States Army
Commandant, NATO Defense College, Paris
Special Assistant to the Defense Secretary
President, Alumni Association, National War College, Washington, D.C.
Retired from the United States Army
Died

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Clovis E. Byers Papers, acquired in 1964, consist of correspondence, memoranda, diaries, speeches and writings, clippings, personnel records, and audio-visual material, relating to the Pacific Theater during World War II, the Army of Occupation in Japan, the Korean War, and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization command in Europe.

The Correspondence, identified as Byers' personal file, includes official correspondence, letters exchanged with friends and colleagues in the military, letters Byers wrote to his family from overseas, and Byers' personal business correspondence.

The bulk of the materials included in the Military File originated from Byers' various assignments with the army. His trips to Korea, the Philippines, Japan, and Europe resulted from his military duties and his association with the NATO Defense College. The Photographs also reflect his assignments in the Pacific, the Philippines, Japan, Korea, and Europe.
As required by law, security-classified materials have been removed from the collection until they can be declassified by government officials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into nine series: Biographical File, Correspondence, Speeches and Writings, Diaries and Appointment Books, Military File, Oversize Materials, Photographs, Sound Recordings and Motion Pictures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Article, awards, bank statements, biographical note, citations, clippings, correspondence, historical records, list, press release, and miscellany relating to Clovis Byers' personal life and professional accomplishments, arranged alphabetically by physical form

scopecontent.p: 2nd Battle Group, 60th Infantry, Order of the Go Devils, undated; "for exceptionally meritorious conduct in the performance of outstanding services in New Guinea," 1944 November 24; Air Medal for "meritorious achievement while participating in aerial flights in the Philippine Islands," 1945 April 29; and 17th Infantry, Order of the Buffalo, 1951 October 24

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Byers' personal file of letters exchanged with military personnel, family and friends, and others. Arranged in Files A ? H, thereunder numerically by folder number. Each numbered folder includes a list of letters in that folder. Additional personal letters from Byers to his family follow File H

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appointment books, daily notes, diaries, and transcripts of diaries, arranged alphabetically by physical form

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bulletin, clippings, correspondence, day lists, fact sheet, financial records, lists, maps, memoranda, messages, note cards, orders, organizational charts, reports, schedule, statements, studies, subject file, and travel records relating to Clovis Byers' military career, arranged alphabetically by physical form

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A comparative study of American, French, German, English, Japanese, Italian, and Russian doctrines on the value of a permanent corps organization for cavalry; the horse, arms, and equipment of the American cavalry trooper compared with those of England, France, Germany, and Spain; development of airborne forces; and sociological study of diseases in XVI Corps

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes studies of equipment of the British cavalry trooper; possible routes of march between El Paso, Texas, and Columbus, New Mexico; attacks in converging directions; research data, and related materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Airborne Division's assessment of aircraft loading characteristics, requirements for airdromes and aircraft, and current airborne developments

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government. Includes some interfiled records determined by the government to be unclassified. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographic and contact prints, illustrations, and albums, depicting Clovis Byers, his family, other army officers, and places he was assigned to for his military duties

did.unittitle: Clippings relating to the invasion of Japan,
Tour of duty in the Pacific and Japan,
Tour of duty of duty in Japan and Europe,
7 prints of British, German, and Spanish cavalry,

2 oversize prints depicting Byers with other officers of the 4th U.S. Cavalry at Fort McIntosh, Texas, January 1922; and with the first-year class, Command and General Staff School, Fort Leavenworth, Kansas,
5 negatives and 2 contact prints depicting unidentified individuals in an outdoor setting,
6 prints including 3 depicting Byers and other unidentified army officers, 1 depicting an open box, 2 depicting moving trains,

14 prints, including 5 illustrations depicting helicopter truck, glider cargo capacities, aircraft load and range characteristics, and the squad boxes, undated; and 9 prints depicting aircraft, parachute, gliders, and helicopters,
9 prints including 8 depicting Byers, Mrs. Byers, and their son; and 1 depicting 8 month old Glen Gray, Jr.,

7 prints including 1 depicting Clovis Byers and Alden K. Sibley during his visit to the U.S. Army Engineer Division, New England, undated; 1 depicting the Watson children wishing a happy holiday season, undated; 2 prints depicting 2 Flak Boas, 1944 March 22; 2 prints depicting Byers sent to him to wish a happy Easter from Yokohama, Japan, 1947; and 1 print depicting Joseph Kormylo. Fort Gulick, Canal Zone,
3 prints including 2 depicting a dog outside a house, 1952 May 29, and 1 commemorative photograph of the Japanese Imperial family,
2 Aug 1875 full retreat dress parade sound recording

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This is a sound recording of a full retreat dress parade of 2 Aug 1875 held at Fort Davis in Texas. It was made for the National Park Service and Fort Davis Historical Site.
